ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Race to 60 (OT)
ygData.msgSnippet: Naggy went down last night by VVV, He had the druid crook, a CoF and a paladin book if you re curious
ygData.messageBody:
Naggy went down last night by VVV, He had the druid crook, a CoF and a
paladin book if you're curious

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Perhaps a Princess... [SMTP:sarah@...]
> Sent: Thursday, May 11, 2000 2:28 PM
> To: eqbards@egroups.com
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Race to 60 (OT)
>
> To some extent, at least the problems with paradigm, come with how
> it was formed. They "stole" players from all the other guilds when
> they were formed. Good ones. And they have never done anything (as
> a guild. Individuals within Paradigm are fine. Others are idiots at
> personal relations) that has made the other guilds want to forgive
> them.
>
> Ashram called set up a Vox hunt for last Saturday night. He talked
> to the other guilds, had outer-guild people participating, etc.
> Paradigm took her down on Friday night. And no, Phoenix doesn't
> yet have the fire resist gear to do Nagafen instead.
>
> Sarah Heacock sarah@...
> Meara Daring, level 24 Enchanter, Master Jeweler, owner Meara's Boutique
> of
> Mystiques, Phoenix, Solusek Ro /
> Faerain Wanderer, level 20 Soldier of Tunare, Phoenix, Solusek Ro /
> Faesong, level 17 HalfElf Bard of Solusek Ro, Phoenix, Solusek Ro (Qeynos)
> /
> <lvl 6 paladin -- baby BASHer!>
>
> >-----Original Message-----
> >From: Cranfill, Wendy [mailto:Wendy_Cranfill@...]
> >Sent: Thursday, May 11, 2000 10:27 AM
>
> >Yeah, we have the same thing on Sol Ro, with Paradigm and The Twelve
> Moons.
> >Both are fairly exclusive allowing only a small number of guests on hunts
> >and not really abiding by others who might try to call a dragon or plane
> >hunt. The bashing they receive is amazing though, and on a whole,
>
